intro: Wurmbea spicata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved star lily, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of star-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The flowers bloom in late summer and are often visited by insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
